page.title: 05HEALTH
page.content: When I am ill my mum rings up the doctor's surgery to make an appointment for as soon as possible and she gets me ready for whenever the appointment is. The surgery is on Dimple Lane. When you get there you have to wait for a while and then the person who has been in will come out and a buzzer will tell the receptionist, Miss Haslam, to call the next patient and she will call out my name. Dr Twist or Dr Macarthur or Dr Shearer sees me and gives me a prescription for pills or antibiotics. Mum takes it to the chemist on the Market Place. The assistant goes into the back room and a few minutes later she comes back with my medicine or pills.I don't have to pay because I am under sixteen.
